definition: face light up with delight (idiom); to beam with joy
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

sentences.english: At the wedding, everyone beamed with delight.
sentences.chinese: 婚禮上的每個人都喜形於色。

sentences.english: Morel subdued, afraid to seem too jubilant in presence of his wife.
sentences.chinese: 毛萊爾默不作聲，唯恐在妻子面前過於喜形於色。

sentences.english: He had brightened at having his name in headline again.
sentences.chinese: 他因自己的名字再次出現在大字標題上而喜形於色。

sentences.english: She swept in, with her complacency.
sentences.chinese: 她喜形於色地昂首走了進來。

sentences.english: He brightened (up) when he heard the good news.
sentences.chinese: 他聽到這個好消息時喜形於色。

sentences.english: I glowed, I could hardly wait to show him my poem .
sentences.chinese: 我喜形於色，我實在等不及地要給他看我的這首詩。

sentences.english: Her evident joy at his return somewhat embarrassed him.
sentences.chinese: 一見到他回來，她就喜形於色，這使他有點不好意思。

sentences.english: They shouted and laughed and cut round.
sentences.chinese: 他們又叫又笑，喜形於色。

sentences.english: She was all smiles at the news of her win.
sentences.chinese: 她聽到自己獲勝的消息喜形於色。

definition: to switch from arrogance to deference (idiom)
to ask (a question) in reply/to answer a question with a question/rhetorical question
to learn by heart/to commit to memory/to remember/to memorize in silence
lit. wind and rain darken the sky (idiom); fig. the situation looks grim
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to keep on the right side of everyone (idiom)/warm and affable
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
ready to die to preserve one's chastity
lit. to bring a bramble and ask for punishment (idiom)/fig. to offer sb a humble apology
